title: JengaHacks 2026: What to Expect
excerpt: Get ready for East Africa's premier hackathon. Here's what's coming to JengaHacks 2026 and why you should be excited.
content:
JengaHacks is back in 2026, and it is shaping up to be our biggest and most exciting year yet. Whether you are a first-time hacker or a returning participant, this year's event is designed to help you build meaningful projects, connect with great people, and walk away with real skills.

Here is what you can expect.

A Hackathon Built for Builders

JengaHacks was created to be accessible, practical, and welcoming. We focus less on flashy demos and more on ideas that solve real problems.

In 2026, you can expect:

  • A supportive environment for beginners
  • Challenging tracks for experienced builders
  • Mentors who care about helping you succeed
  • Clear judging criteria and transparent feedback

Our goal is simple. If you show up curious and ready to learn, you belong here.

2026 Tracks

This year's tracks are designed around real-world impact and modern technology. Teams can choose the track that best fits their interests or mix ideas across tracks.

üåç Social Impact and Sustainability

Build solutions that address challenges in health, education, climate, agriculture, or access to services. Projects in this track should focus on real people and real outcomes.

üíº Fintech and Digital Economy

Explore payments, financial inclusion, small business tools, or new ways to support the growing digital economy across Africa.

ü§ñ AI and Emerging Tech

Use machine learning, data, or automation to solve problems creatively and responsibly. Strong projects clearly explain how AI improves the solution, not just that it uses it.

üéì Student Innovation

A space for newer hackers and students to experiment, learn, and build confidently. This track emphasizes learning, creativity, and execution over complexity.

Prizes That Actually Matter

Winning is exciting, but we believe prizes should help teams keep going after the hackathon ends.

For JengaHacks 2026, prizes may include:

  • Cash awards
  • Cloud credits and developer tools
  • Mentorship and startup support
  • Opportunities to showcase your project publicly

More details will be announced closer to the event.

Mentors, Workshops, and Support

You will not be building alone.

Throughout the weekend, participants will have access to:

  • Technical mentors
  • Design and product guidance
  • Short workshops on pitching, teamwork, and rapid prototyping
  • Office hours to unblock stuck teams

Mentors are there to help, not judge. Ask questions early and often.

How Teams and Judging Work

Teams can be formed ahead of time or at the event. Most teams are between two and four people.

Judging focuses on:

  • Problem clarity
  • Quality of solution
  • Execution and usability
  • Impact and feasibility
  • Presentation

You do not need a perfect product. You need a clear idea and a working demo.

Who Should Apply

JengaHacks is open to:

  • Students
  • Early-career developers
  • Designers and product thinkers
  • Anyone curious about building technology

You do not need prior hackathon experience. You just need the willingness to try.

Key Dates and Next Steps

Applications, full schedules, and partner announcements will be shared soon. Keep an eye on our website and social channels for updates.

If you are thinking about joining, now is a great time to start:

  • Brushing up on a new tool
  • Talking with friends about ideas
  • Getting excited about building something new

Final Thoughts

JengaHacks 2026 is about more than a weekend of coding. It is about learning fast, meeting people who care, and building things that matter.

We cannot wait to see what you create.
author: JengaHacks Team
